name: NextByte
headline: AI Recruiting Agent for Screening Technical Candidates
description:
NextByte’s AI recruiter agent helps you identify top candidates faster, so your team can focus on what matters – building your product and hiring the best talent. Our platform understands the requirements for each role and tailors voice-driven technical and non-technical evaluations to surface candidates who are ready for your next onsite interview. 

NextByte can screen hundreds of candidates simultaneously and provides rubric-based, detailed evaluations in minutes. Our analytics dashboards provide a clear view of technical ability, problem-solving skills, and communication under pressure across your candidate pool, so you can confidently move the right candidates forward. With NextByte, hiring teams save time, reduce bias, and make faster, data-driven hiring decisions without sacrificing quality.
tags: industry:saas; industry:b2b; industry:recruiting; industry:ai; industry:conversational-ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Jason Madeano, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder and CEO of Nextbyte

Prior to Nextbyte, Jason was a Machine Learning Engineer at Pinterest, specializing in Homefeed Relevance and Recommendation Systems. He holds a Master’s and Bachelor’s degree from MIT in Computer Science and Brain & Cognitive Science.

founders.name: Matt Stallone, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of NextByte.

Before tackling agents, Matt was leading the post-training of Foundation Language Models at IBM Research, working on major releases including the Granite model series. He is classically trained in ML and Distributed Systems and holds Master's and Bachelor's degrees from MIT in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering.

generated_description:
**NextByte: Your AI Recruiting Agent**

Founded in 2025 and backed by the renowned Y Combinator Batch W25, NextByte is carving out a niche in the tech recruiting landscape. Based in San Francisco with a lean team of just two, the company aims to revolutionize how businesses identify and evaluate technical talent through innovative AI-driven assessments.

### The Mission

NextByte's mission is clear: to streamline the recruitment process for tech roles by employing an AI Recruiting Agent. Their platform accelerates the journey from job posting to interview, allowing hiring teams to focus on what truly matters—building their products and snagging top talent. 

### How It Works

NextByte’s AI agent conducts both technical and conversational evaluations tailored to the specifics of each job role. Here’s a quick outline of their process:

1. **Tailored Phone Screening**: The AI has natural conversations with candidates to quickly determine if they meet the job requirements.
   
2. **Smart Technical Interviews**: Candidates tackle coding challenges while the AI evaluates their thought processes and problem-solving skills in real time.

3. **Rapid Assessment Reports**: After evaluations, hiring teams receive detailed, rubric-based reports highlighting each candidate's technical abilities, problem-solving capabilities, and communication skills under pressure.

NextByte’s platform can screen hundreds of candidates at once, producing comprehensive evaluations within minutes. This not only saves time but also reduces bias, enabling companies to make informed, data-driven hiring decisions without compromising quality.

### Key Features

- **Efficiency**: Quickly identify and assess top candidates.
- **Accuracy**: AI-driven evaluations yield consistent assessments, minimizing biases.
- **Analytics Dashboards**: Gain insights into technical abilities and soft skills across your candidate pool.

### The Bigger Picture

In a world where finding skilled technical talent can often feel like searching for a needle in a haystack, NextByte positions itself as a game changer. Their AI tools not only enhance efficiency but also foster a fairer hiring process. As they continue to evolve and grow, NextByte is certainly one to watch in the SaaS, B2B, and recruitment spaces.

For more information or to see the platform in action, check out their website at [NextByte](https://trynextbyte.com).
